creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Stephen Addiss and Audrey Yoshiko Seo in honor of Dr Frederick Baekeland on his 80th Birthday
description: two lines of cursive calligraphy; bold characters
inscription: (Silk and cassia wood together/ make a qin-zither, Within it are ancient melodies/ Po Chu-i
markings: Marks: Japanese and English translation in blue pen on top when rolled; pencil on top when rolled: [1971]; L top when rolled, stamped: [Japan]; Seals: URC; LLQ; Labels: L and R roller ends: [Kako / Poem]
title: Hanging scroll
